info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 4 at 6:18PM CDT until April 4 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of southwest Illinois, including the following county, Madison and east central Missouri, including the following independent city, northeastern Saint Louis City.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 618 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Louis, Granite City, Alton, Collinsville, Edwardsville, Godfrey, Glen Carbon, Wood River, Highland, Troy, Bethalto, Maryville, Pontoon Beach, Staunton, Madison, Venice, East Alton, Fairmont City, South Roxana and Roxana.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Madison, IL; St. Louis City, MO
